articles.description: World number one Jannik Sinner considered walking away from tennis during his doping case, stating he "didn't feel comfortable" as players looked at him "differently" during the Australian Open.
articles.title: Jannik Sinner: Italian considered quitting tennis during doping case

articles.description: Inter Milan's record Champions League scorer will be bidding to beat Barca and lead his club to this season's final.
articles.title: Barcelona v Inter Milan: Lautaro Martinez's rise to the top

articles.description: Follow text commentary and listen on 5 Sports Extra as Aston Villa host Arsenal in the Women's Super League, before leaders Chelsea play Manchester United.
articles.title: WSL LIVE: Aston Villa v Arsenal & Manchester United v Chelsea

articles.description: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland has returned to full training following an ankle injury suffered at the end of March.
articles.title: Erling Haaland: Manchester City striker back in full training after ankle injury

articles.description: BBC Sport's Alex Howell assesses why Arsenal fans should still be hopeful that their side can reach the Champions League final.
articles.title: Champions League: Why Arsenal can beat PSG in semi-final second leg

articles.description: Mark Wood is irritated by a "golf, golf, golf" narrative around the England team, but admits they do not help themselves.
articles.title: Mark Wood rejects notion England cricketers play too much golf

articles.description: Rory McIlroy will play the Scottish Open at the Renaissance Club as part of his preparations for the Open Championship in his native Northern Ireland this summer.
articles.title: Scottish Open 2025: Rory McIlroy to play at Renaissance Club before Open Championship tilt

articles.description: James Maddison says Tottenham's squad are "100%" behind manager Ange Postecoglou and can still turn their season into "something very special".
articles.title: Tottenham: James Maddison says Spurs are '100%' behind Ange Postecoglou

articles.description: Former Premier League manager Harry Redknapp says calling England boss Thomas Tuchel "a German spy" was a "joke" that "badly backfired".
articles.title: Harry Redknapp says 'joke' about Thomas Tuchel 'badly backfired'

articles.description: Three-time winner Mark Williams holds off a John Higgins fightback to win a World Championship classic 13-12 on the final black and reach the semi-finals.
articles.title: 2025 World Snooker Championship: Mark Williams beats John Higgins in quarter-final
